metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46871 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out of date library (libusrsctp) contained vulnerabilities that could potentially be exploited. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap sbeattie> libusrsctp fixed upstream in 0.9.4.0 specific issue is a failure to perform reference counting correctly, and thus race conditions that lead to use-after-frees are possible.

mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
